result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric M Bader was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $150 fine plus costs. If fine and costs are not paid in full by 10/16/16, stay on jail time will be lifted.

Stayed. If Defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 10/16/16, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 10/16/16, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Eric M Bader in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant on progress with DA. Defendant thinks case is resolved. State advises of plea agreement. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State makes sentencing recommendations. Court imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.

ADDRESS INFO for Eric M Bader
Current: 803 Fredrick Court,  Apt. 7, Green Bay, WI 54313   (Effective: 07-06-2016)
Prior: 803 Fredrick Ct, Green Bay, WI 54313
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No contact direct or indirect with Stone Harbor Resort or be on the premises.

Defendant Eric M Bader in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.
